page.title: 18Farming / Chapel Farm
page.content: {Chapel Farm is a mixed farm}.It has about 100 acres of lowland pasturage. {Chapel Farm }has 18 dairy cows,and 7 suckler cows. When the farm first started in the 1700's,the cows would stay in a little byre.Then a bigger byre was built where cows can be milked by machine. The cows stay in cubicles in winter. The milk goes to the{Milk Marketing Board. There are 60{Swaledale}ewes,10{Jacob's ewes,and 16{Leicester}tups.{Swaledale are tough for cross-breeding from. {Leicesters }make good tup lambs.{ {Jacob's }have attractive brown and cream fleeces. Lambs are weaned in August. Ewes are clipped at the end of June. Sheep are dipped twice a year against sheep scab.
